oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Cereal landrace farmers in Finland and their motivation to on-farm conservation
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Heinonen, Maarit
Veteläinen, Merja
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Biodiversity and ecosystem services
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The ‘OnFarmFinland’ project has resulted in a web-based information service containing knowledge of Finnish landraces and old commercial varieties of some agri- and horticultural plants. In the first phase, knowledge of cereals and potatoes is provided. The ‘Landrace Information Service’ (MaatiaisTietoPankki 2011) is part of the web-site of the national PGR programme in Finland at the portal of MTT Agrifood Research Finland. The information service is targeted for present landrace farmers, hobby-gardeners, agrarian museums and other organizations, and private persons interested. The information is expected to be useful in restoring historical gardens and fields, in building demonstration gardens, in education uses, in development of niche products, and in general in enhancement of the awareness of landraces among the general public.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Heinonen, Maarit and Veteläinen, Merja (2011) Cereal landrace farmers in Finland and their motivation to on-farm conservation. Paper at: Biodiversity in agriculture - lessons learned and future directions, NJF seminar 436, Ulvik in Hardanger, Norway, 24-26 May 2011.
